data.text:
"It's essential to treat human beings as equal & respect them for who they are." - @UN_PGA welcomed students to UNHQ for #BlackHistoryMonth.

@VisitUN has details about how YOU can take a special tour featuring the "Ark of Return" slavery memorial & more: https://t.co/Snvm2ejpuL https://t.co/uXWJ5gUrWQ

What you say matters! 

Help create a more equal world by using gender-neutral language if you're unsure about someone's gender or are referring to a group. https://t.co/9DkJpsP6x9 #GenerationEquality via @UN_Women https://t.co/Ao1LvKUDPd

Libya: Talks in Geneva are meant to help translate truce into permanent & lasting ceasefire, says @UNSMILibya chief Ghassan Salamé. 
https://t.co/Wx9VLFWjCh https://t.co/uD45ijVkj3

.@WHO is sending urgent medical supplies to countries affected by #Coronavirus, and convening global research meeting aimed at developing vaccine & treatments. 

Latest updates on the outbreak here: https://t.co/JfHGQwTa6p https://t.co/lWnfeOnhlg

The ocean 
🌊 covers 70% of the Earth’s surface
🐠 is home to up to 80% of all life 
💨 generates 50% percent of the oxygen we need

The UN Ocean Conference in Portugal in June is set to be a critical moment to #SaveOurOcean. 
https://t.co/eUyaJnwkE1

Cancer cases could increase by 60% over the next 20 years.

On Tuesday's #WorldCancerDay, @WHO has outlined steps to save 7 million lives, including by tackling inequalities in cancer services. https://t.co/JNjxknxvlO https://t.co/fLpqQeTTQY

"Now is the time to break the vicious circle of poverty and inequality and to shape a fair globalization leaving no one behind."

-- @antonioguterres speaking to reporters about his priorities for 2020. https://t.co/VLPCEluiYz https://t.co/fSsSTDbG6y

Watch live as @antonioguterres speaks to reporters about his priorities for 2020. 

https://t.co/3kdj72vRwb

.@UN_Disarmament is looking for young people to help create a more peaceful world.
Apply by 18 March to become a Youth Champion for Disarmament: https://t.co/XQmHVxVILz 

https://t.co/GIBzU33t38

Reducing risk factors & early diagnosis are 🗝️ to beating cancer.

Find out more on Tuesday's #WorldCancerDay: https://t.co/MmtMwLF2HJ #GlobalGoals https://t.co/alxkk6qoen

"The things that we think, the things that we do, are critical in fighting genocides, in fighting the holocausts of the future."

-- Judge Theodor Meron, World War II survivor & former war crimes judge, about the importance of heeding lessons from the past. https://t.co/GdLR0l1j3A
On Tuesday's #WorldCancerDay, @pahowho is calling on people everywhere to help reduce the impact of cancer. https://t.co/AKDJBPaS7b #HealthForAll https://t.co/6f9yegpMB8

New global programme on #SportsAgainstTerrorism is aimed at protecting major sports events and promoting the values of sports to prevent violent extremism.
https://t.co/JTLZgkVK52

Cancer is the second-leading cause of death worldwide. 

On Tuesday's #WorldCancerDay, @WHO has tips on how to reduce your cancer risk. https://t.co/MmtMwLF2HJ https://t.co/2jMLGzLHTK

Syria: Over half a million people have fled escalating violence in Idlib since December. Around 80% of them are women & children.  

@UNICEF is delivering life-saving assistance to #ChldrenUnderAttack & their families. https://t.co/3SxU16TvQQ https://t.co/Bw5yF2c7zw

More than $2 trillion dollars are lost every year through the illicit trade of goods. 

This week's @UNCTAD Illicit Trade forum in Geneva focuses on solutions for tackling the issue. https://t.co/dudXypxydZ

https://t.co/lYMXv5efBd

New medical air bridge operation brings first group of Yemeni patients in need of specialized medical assistance from Yemen to Jordan.

@WHO, local authorities & partners are working together to coordinate flights. via @OSE_Yemen https://t.co/cGNUzRADD9

It's Interfaith Harmony Week!

Here's how @UNAOC works to bridge divides all year round: https://t.co/Dbm8f2PeTR #GlobalGoals https://t.co/ANTxbPMA0z

8200+ @UNVolunteers supported 40+ UN partners in achieving the #GlobalGoals across 140+ countries & territories in 2019. 

In 2020, you could become one of them. https://t.co/m1h7Dcu6jY https://t.co/kv4eRTIiMI

Recognition
Justice
Development

This #BlackHistoryMonth, find out about the International Decade of People of #AfricanDescent: https://t.co/SyNBqSUUKt #FightRacism https://t.co/2Xz2tFkmP1
Happening this week: #WorldCancerDay, #EndFGM Day & much more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cv967 https://t.co/0HaNGUWRor
Behind the scenes: Get to know one of the UN's most senior officials, @UNDPPA Chief @DicarloRosemary, and her work to promote peace & security around the world. https://t.co/CDzbrMlZlW

“When the women in the Protection of Civilians site see me at dawn, in charge of & training male colleagues, they look at me as a motivator.”

- Vera Ayensu, @UNPOL officer #ServingForPeace with @unmissmedia. 

Find out about women in @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/KStGbcKZoh #A4P https://t.co/llBU6HYOCn

Seasonal influenza kills up to 650,000 people every year.

Get info from @WHO on how to prevent the flu & recognize the symptoms - and what to do when you have it: https://t.co/P88w8dH53s #GlobalGoals https://t.co/BtuDm9nIkZ
Happening Monday at UNHQ: launch of global programme on #SportsAgainstTerrorism. Details: https://t.co/K1alkGy4I9 https://t.co/fqbP4DTm4H

Wetlands are crucial for #ClimateAction, but they are disappearing three time faster than forests due to the climate emergency. 

 More on Sunday's #WorldWetlandsDay: https://t.co/T9h6jpR68j https://t.co/TsTztSLjBU

👉Are you between 15 and 29 years old?
👉Passionate about the #GlobalGoals?

Now's your chance to be one of the next #SDGYoungLeaders! 

Apply before 22 Feb: https://t.co/iavYYilKEe via @UNYouthEnvoy https://t.co/mCDJy12x3p

About half of the world's population does not have access to the Internet.
Many of them live in developing countries. @ITU is working to reduce the digital divide around the world. https://t.co/7wkjkTxaHv https://t.co/kkrbp0Rdsf

The climate emergency is one of the main drivers of hunger. 

See how @WFP is working to prevent & respond to food insecurity caused by the impacts of the climate crisis. https://t.co/l4resWdvZH #ClimateAction https://t.co/ckqMsTEPxE

40% of the world’s plant & animal species live or breed in wetlands. 

On Sunday's #WorldWetlandsDay, learn more about the importance of wetlands: https://t.co/T9h6jpR68j https://t.co/50q4yj4Rgq

Switching off lights 💡, even just for a short time, can save more energy than it takes for them to start up again.

Small #ClimateAction steps like this one can make a big difference. Here's how YOU can #ActNow to protect our planet: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/7o3r0RnXRj

This week we welcomed #NYCJuniorAmbassadors to UNHQ where they showed their support for the #GlobalGoals!

More about the @globalnyc programme: https://t.co/W59gdwIq5s via @VisitUN https://t.co/Yiqd5Tcbpu

Pneumonia is the biggest infectious killer of children worldwide, claiming the lives of 800,000+ children under five each year. 

@UNICEF has details on the risk of pneumonia in children & tips on staying healthy. https://t.co/f3RmYTHdm3 https://t.co/VQ5fGK4Ds2

"We proved that women’s active participation in a peace process can make a significant difference."

-- Nobel Laureate @LeymahRGbowee on the important role of women for peace. https://t.co/XHnRXGPlQk via @AfricaRenewal https://t.co/1XH5JbBegt

Simple steps can help you stay healthy while traveling:
- Wash your hands frequently. 🤚 
- Try not to touch your eyes, nose or mouth. ❌
- Avoid contact with people with a cough or fever. 🤒 

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/tsGUhMZQ6s https://t.co/cXbD4wqsYZ

“I’m here to listen to you, and to bring your concerns to your political leaders."

-- @UNYouthEnvoy spent a week in South Sudan listening to young people's hopes and challenges: https://t.co/vOnKdz3db1 https://t.co/rQb5focplL
Saturday: @BelgiumUN takes on rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of February. https://t.co/n0nNG8oLvj https://t.co/ITeQg1GeH6

Tourism - which often depends on Earth’s natural beauty - is also making enormous contributions to its decay.

New initiative is set to bring the tourism sector together under a common vision to #BeatPlasticPollution: https://t.co/26VCgzuLaj via @UNEP 

 https://t.co/hVky8kBv9I
Central African Republic: UN Security Council renews arms embargo, a key element to ensure peace and stability in the country: https://t.co/y6g29nddrp https://t.co/eW9uJdUXEW
As desert locust outbreak worsens, @FAO calls for urgent funding to prevent humanitarian crisis in Horn of Africa. https://t.co/xo9LHvIGno #ZeroHunger https://t.co/bgiQr1XBXp

As crises unfold all around Niger, innovative projects in the country continue to help refugees & host communities. 

@Refugees Chief @FilippoGrandi visited a new housing project that's paving the way for a better future. https://t.co/A5g7Spp3MA https://t.co/aHaKE3qp5H

Each month, @WFP & partners deliver emergency food assistance to 3 million people in Syria. Follow the journey of @WFP_Syria food support.  
https://t.co/ohmQi8Hc20 https://t.co/QGf45krMPs

Libya: Greater unity needed to reduce risk of full-scale conflict & further misery for civilians, @UNSMILibya chief Ghassan Salame warns Security Council.
https://t.co/wfYToUxGgW

Full participation of women is critical to meaningfully peace processes.

In Mali, @UNPeacekeeping chief @Lacroix_UN met with women leaders who work to make sustainable peace a reality for the country. https://t.co/JRTNNEUSOj https://t.co/n9lCGZiTyH
Iraq: Amid ongoing protests & violence, Head of @UNIraq urges stepped up efforts to break political deadlock. https://t.co/ylxAYn5JDO

Libya: @Refugees suspending its operations at gathering & departure facility in Tripoli due to safety concerns caused by worsening violence.

Relocation efforts for most vulnerable refugees & asylum seekers are underway. https://t.co/MB7R3pk6TX https://t.co/sxgaF1vXyd

NEWS: #Coronavirus declared a public health emergency of international concern by @WHO. 

Global outbreak includes 98 cases in 18 countries, outside China. 

More info, including tips on how to stay healthy: https://t.co/tsGUhNhrv2 https://t.co/ZDyTXeVXyg

Meet 12-year-old Rania from Yemen, whose enthusiasm for learning is unshakable, despite living in difficult conditions. 

See how @UNICEF is supporting children like her in Yemen:  https://t.co/Wk7HGLqPQv https://t.co/2OhDMA77Wh

About 75% of emerging infectious diseases are ‘zoonotic’ -- meaning they can spread from animals to humans. 

More on how @FAO is working to keep animals healthy in order to prevent disease outbreaks & pandemics among humans: https://t.co/xivFM28CUU

A new novel weaves together the story of a 12-year-old girl who survived the Hiroshima atomic bomb with a stark warning about nuclear disarmament.

Hear from the author of "The Last Cherry Blossom" in our latest podcast. 🎧
https://t.co/IdEZi4OCZb

In Sudan, @unamidnews has distributed solar wind-up radios to vulnerable communities, helping them access life-saving information. 

More on the work of the mission in Darfur: https://t.co/YAkK3EfoTK https://t.co/TnTOha7fOK

Syria: Escalating hostilities in northwest part of country leaving traumatized civilians under siege. 

Dire and deteriorating humanitarian situation particularly affecting women and children. https://t.co/NOpZFFxiTZ

.@UNICEF is supporting response to #coronavirus by shipping six metric tons of medical supplies to China, including respiratory masks & protective suits for health workers. https://t.co/gMOjbgmVGG https://t.co/igMekYmuih

“Political leaders tend to talk too much and to listen too little."
@antonioguterres heard from young people about their hopes for the future at a special event to mark the UN's 75th anniversary. Join the #UN75 conversation: https://t.co/gBJDdJdlvv https://t.co/lHg8bM4515

Wrapping up visit to Democratic Republic of Congo, @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet urges Government to seize opportunity to move away from conflict, rights violations & socio-economic problems. https://t.co/u2I5EbcTvz https://t.co/knDd2rJpMB

Watch live as @antonioguterres welcomes young people from around the world to share their ideas & solutions for a better future. https://t.co/gBJDdJdlvv #UN75

https://t.co/tYx96wvOp2

From healthcare to agriculture, solar power can improve the lives of people around the world.
More about @UNDP's #Solar4Health initiative: https://t.co/YfxZ7i2mFK 

https://t.co/beNWpwPvSi

Nearly 5 million children in Burkina Faso, Mali & Niger will need humanitarian assistance in 2020, as on-going conflict in the Sahel takes a devastating toll on children's safety, health & education. #ChildrenUnderAttack
https://t.co/gyDwoO1Ija
Yemen: Escalation in violence between pro-Government & rebel forces must stop before it's too late, @OSE_Yemen warns Security Council. https://t.co/wLIx80oTVN

240+ public meetings 
50+ resolutions 

A push toward greater transparency as well as rising geo-political tensions shaped the Security Council's work over the last year. Take an in-depth look at the Council's proceedings in 2019. https://t.co/bdRybJlZV6
UN Counter-Terrorism Committee meets to explore terrorist narratives & strategies for preventing terrorists' use of the Internet. https://t.co/wVXxNle2a5 via @UN_CTED https://t.co/lXqE2M6pJY
A new UN high-level panel on financial accountability, transparency & integrity is aimed at helping achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/nqYLTdjS7u

Violence is worsening food insecurity in Burkina Faso, Niger and Mali. 

@WFP explains 5 things you need to know about the spiraling situation in the Sahel region: https://t.co/NYKBRidlqy https://t.co/cvqSmUjHIL

“This place is under threat.”

Following his pioneering swim under the Antarctic ice sheet, @UNEP Patron of the Oceans @LewisPugh calls for urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/xAeCbvjlzJ

 https://t.co/TMq297OaDB

.@WHO is working closely with countries affected by #coronavirus and teaming up with experts to coordinate global surveillance & treatment network. 

More on coronavirus, including tips on how to stay healthy. https://t.co/dXd4WQrDOK

 https://t.co/LkydA5CQKH
The @UNYouthEnvoy is in South Sudan, the youngest country in the world, to listen to the voices of young people and their ideas for a better future.  #Youth2030 https://t.co/65QbMVEhu9

From primary school to university, Model United Nations simulations are popular exercises for students interested in learning more about how the UN works. Find out how you can join here: https://t.co/lnY1L6eH9E https://t.co/yL6C31nXlo

UN peacekeepers are #ServingforPeace in some of the world's most dangerous places. They: 
➡️ Maintain peace & security
➡️ Protect civilians
➡️ Disarm combatants
➡️ Promote human rights 
➡️ Support elections

More about @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/2ZO2zNpLhE #A4P https://t.co/MkjthKVlnW

75 years after the liberation of Auschwitz, @antonioguterres calls for greater solidarity in the face of rising anti-Semitism, as Holocaust survivors & family members gather at UNHQ on Monday's #HolocaustRemembrance Day. https://t.co/5vM7ln4QTY https://t.co/WWjEKo94Wm

For 25 years, @UNFCCC has supported the development of institutions & initiatives around the world to help build resilience and adapt to the impacts of the climate emergency. https://t.co/Pkjr3L5RIt #ClimateAction 

 https://t.co/OjxycRFXRb

"There is a global crisis of antisemitic hatred; a constant stream of attacks targeting Jews, their institutions & property."

-- @antonioguterres calls for solidarity on Monday's #HolocaustRemembrance Day. https://t.co/kS02THL1Pa https://t.co/WtUjeudLIB

Unvaccinated people can spread diseases quickly, posing risks to: 
👶 Infants too young to get vaccines
👴🧓 Older adults at risk of serious disease
🤒 People with low immunity

More from @WHO on why immunization is a shared responsibility. https://t.co/IjMD0ge2Ws #VaccinesWork https://t.co/z1jIN5jnUl

Pictures of Auschwitz are vital evidence of the Nazis’ crimes. They help us educate, remember and strengthen resolve to achieve justice & dignity for all. 

@seeingAuschwitz exhibit is on display at UNHQ on Monday's #HolocaustRemembrance Day: https://t.co/8Fnfva9xY6 https://t.co/jWbmp1I2gq

✔️ Be kind
✔️ Speak out
✔️ Involve parents
✔️ Promote discussion

More tips from @UNICEF for students, parents & teachers to #EndViolence in schools: https://t.co/yc8VM0puk7 https://t.co/ElP4oTIwh1

2020 marks the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz - and the ending of the Holocaust.

Monday's #HolocaustRemembrance Day highlights the importance of standing 
 united against antisemitism, bigotry and hatred. https://t.co/HFBOU0LHGO https://t.co/jVYdwUJQWH

Sunday is #WorldLeprosyDay. 

Ending the stigma associated with the disease and ensuring early detection are key for treatment and can prevent disability. https://t.co/sbQZ8ygoBM via @WHO https://t.co/0tYH4g8jit

"Today and every day, we commemorate the victims of the Holocaust by pursuing truth, remembrance and education."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's #HolocaustRemembrance Day. https://t.co/5JvJCTpTrf https://t.co/0QM2SNFMti

The Decade of Action to deliver the #GlobalGoals was front and centre at the SDG Media Zone in Davos this week. 

Watch #SDGLive sessions for more on how the UN is mobilizing governments, businesses, civil society & youth. https://t.co/Z0XoJa7p7c via @GlobalCompact https://t.co/c7dfEWlslD

Only about half of the necessary data is available on some of the world's most pressing humanitarian crises, presenting serious challenges in addressing the needs of the most vulnerable. 

More in latest @humdata report. https://t.co/OsTxaN2OTj https://t.co/q78hpnTX9M

The Decade of Action to achieve the #GlobalGoals is underway!

We all have a role to play to achieve a better world by 2030. https://t.co/7OIyGEWguU https://t.co/5Zk4fvf1cC

Do you know where your country's imports are coming from?

New @UNCTAD tool shows their origin how they are all interconnected. https://t.co/GQFmKW1vzB https://t.co/lIGNQa7kSk

Hundreds of thousands of women like Razia have experienced obstetric fistula.

More on her story and how @UNFPA has helped more than 105,000 women in 55 countries overcome the devastating childbirth injury. https://t.co/p4TCBUcYer https://t.co/FUVJjUvh6u

From rising geopolitical tensions to the climate crisis, 
@antonioguterres looks ahead to 2020 & stresses the need for multilateral solutions to some of the most serious threats facing the world today. https://t.co/Bnzl7OXP6K https://t.co/ltCiJhjNLa

"Some Were Neighbours" 

#HolocaustRemembrance exhibit on display at UNHQ examines individual choices, reminding us that there is an alternative to complicity in evil acts—even in extraordinary times. 

https://t.co/Rj7GlI6yCt https://t.co/pBbpYoc7Tq

We need more women in science! 👩🏽‍🔬

"Let's get to work and change the world!" 

#ClimateAction supporter @BillNye visited UNHQ this week. 

Here's how you too can help preserve our planet: https://t.co/3JUFPUc1SF https://t.co/Myremx6SeA

“The planet will not be destroyed. What will be destroyed is our capacity to live on the planet.” 
-@antonioguterres talked #ClimateAction action at #wef20. https://t.co/JRNBPycBgm

.@WFP's  all-terrain vehicles have been critical for distributing food to those living in remote villages affected by recent flooding in South Sudan.

More than $10M has been released from @UNCERF in response to the devastating desert locust outbreak in East Africa. 

It's the worst of its kind for 25 years in Ethiopia & Somalia – and the worst Kenya has seen for 70 years. https://t.co/8t2uL6S1uG https://t.co/dHUmvw3zq5

“Everytime I read a supposedly gender neutral word, like doctor or lawyer, I kept picturing a man in my head.” 

Award-winning feminist campaigner @CCriadoPerez was at UNHQ to discuss her bestselling book #InvisibleWomen & all things gender equality. https://t.co/XhChZpb76V https://t.co/FGDtGRtj01

"The power of education reaches far beyond the individual child and his or her family. Education is a strategic development opportunity." 

-- @UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador @muzoonrakan1 on Friday's #EducationDay. https://t.co/VJfPdlM8Qa https://t.co/reXam5bUBc

A quality education can transform lives by helping people overcome  poverty, inequality & discrimination. It's also a human right.

Friday is #EducationDay. https://t.co/jVynpiRQDS https://t.co/DgMqLnl0pN

"Around the world, violence, discrimination & expressions of hostility motivated by anti-semitism have created a climate of fear."

On 75th anniversary of liberation of Auschwitz, @UNHumanRights experts call for urgent action to combat anti-semitism. https://t.co/cXUCDhhIsE https://t.co/IxMq7O9map

617 million children & youth lack basic reading and math skills.

On Friday's #EducationDay, join @UNESCO in calling for quality education for everyone. https://t.co/jVynpiRQDS https://t.co/oKdMaecSMb

There is increasing concern about a desert locust outbreak, which is threatening devastation in East Africa.

A small swarm of locusts can consume the equivalent of food for 35,000 people in just one day. 

More facts from @FAO. https://t.co/sGRQAvbYbK https://t.co/tYR2yUqYDN
